page.title: 19WORK
page.content:
The village of Souldrop grew to meet the needs for labour on the farms and at the nearby{Colworth Estate.} At the turn of the century many local people were employed on the estate but now only a few people in the area work for Unilever, the current owner. Unilever's Colworth site is now one of the largest food research establishments in Europe, employing about 1000 people.
Some of the first people to work outside of the immediate area were {shoe workers}in Rushden in the early 1920's, farm mechanisation having led to a surplus of labour. A few work on the farms in the area, some work in Rushden or Thurleigh, while others{commute}further afield to Bedford, Luton and even London.
